Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lid; interior glazed black; exterior: from centre: glazed area; dilute band; black-figure frieze: upper part of draped bearded male figure to right (with added red on hair, beard and top of garment) and upper part of draped youth, to right (red fillet and back of garment).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.39)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 263, no. 33)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 345, no. B426)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0828) (Phase 1)
